p: Before the high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) analysis, 0.5 g of the seed oil was diluted with 5 mL of hexane, and 5 μL of the sample was then injected. The tocopherol composition of the seed oils was determined by HPLC in accordance with the standard [NF EN ISO 9936] [ 46, 47]. The samples were then analyzed by HPLC (Agilent 1100, Palo Alto, CA, USA), as previously described by Debbabi et al. [ 46] and Badreddine et al. [ 47]. The quantification was based on an external standard method and the tocopherol standards were mixed in a solution of hexane (2 mg/mL) prepared on the basis of the standard compounds: α-, β-, γ- and δ-tocopherols.
